Posts.Content: Janice, Are you still around? How did it go with your students? I teach fourth grade. Since I am undergoing chemo and have missed quite a bit of time and my hair will fall out, I told my students. We were studying a unit on medicine in Language Arts at the time. I read them excerpts from a children's book on cancer so they would understand what it was. I explained the doctors found some cancer cells in my body and that they were going to give me medicine or chemotherapy to make me better. I explained that I might miss some time from work in order to see the doctor but that was because I was working very hard at getting better. One student did ask if I was going to die. I answered honestly that I didn't believe so but that we all do die at some point in our lives, and no one can no for sure what will happen tomorrow. They seemed to accept this and I didn't have to lie to them. I lost a parent at a young age and I wish people had been more honest with me.
Posts.Signature: Age 37 dx 1/31/05 IDC 8cm nodes+, #? Grade 3 ER/PR-/Her-2- miscarriage 13 wks chemo 2/22/05 TAC, every 3 wks masectomy planned after chemo
Posts.Title: telling students

Posts.Content: For me they're using Neulastra shots and Levaquin, an antibiotic because my count went down to 1.1 on the first chemo. Might I ask why you don't want to try the drugs? Dietary supplements might help, but Neulastra will more likely do the trick.
Posts.Signature: Age 37 dx 1/31/05 IDC 8cm nodes+, #? Grade 3 ER/PR-/Her-2- miscarriage 13 wks chemo 2/22/05 TAC, every 3 wks masectomy planned after chemo
Posts.Title: suggest on how to raise WBC

Posts.Content: Instead of waiting until all my hair falls out in clumps, I decided to shave it. I have a friend who's a professional photographer who allowed my husband to shave it in his studio. He took quite a few pictures using different filters and lighting. I decided to try and feel extra sexy by wearing a lacy dress, high heels and full make-up. We played music and joked, while our friend photographed it all. I feel very empowered by being able to choose when and how I lost my hair. Can't wait till the pictures are developed.
Posts.Title: Shaved My Head!

Posts.Content: Margie, good hearing from you. Sounds like you have a very supportive husband.
Posts.Title: Shaved My Head!

Posts.Content: Well Shelly, I'm starting to see the benefits now. Trimming hair back any amount helps when the hair falls out. I'm shedding stubble on my head like crazy which is preferrable to having long hair all over my pillow and in the shower drain.

Posts.Title: Books

Posts.Content: I went online and ordered a few more books to prepare myself for the road ahead. I'm still eagerly awaiting Breast Cancer for Dummies. I also picked Just Get Me Through This! because it sounded like it would also be a good practical guide. What the description and the book cover did not indicate was that it's only for Stage I and II breast cancer women. Though after I start reading it, the author claims that if this book was recommended to me that I must be a woman with early cancer (I & II). Won't the treatment of a Stage III patient be similiar as far as chemo, surgery and radiation? I've only read the first 27 pages but I don't like that she keeps wanting to put Stage I & II people in an entirely different category from Stage III and IV, as if they are the people with cancer and we are the "cancer patients that will eventually die from the disease." Has anyone else read this book?
Posts.Signature: Age 37 dx 1/31/05 IDC 8cm nodes+, #? Grade 3 ER/PR-/Her-2- miscarriage 13 wks chemo 2/22/05 TAC, every 3 wks masectomy planned after chemo

Posts.Title: Books

Posts.Content: I've had two rounds of TAC and have my 3rd tomorrow. After the first one I had no pain. Two days after my second dose I was feeling pretty good so I went for a long walk and had horrendous pain in my lower back and legs. I used massage and meditation to relieve the pain and it did after a day or so. Hope this time goes smoother. I'll stick with the Neulasta for now as my WBCs got very low the last two times and I'm working full time as an elementary school teacher.

Posts.Content: RM, Also talking to a medical oncologist before surgery is a good idea. Sometimes chemo can be done first to shrink tumors and lymph nodes before the surgery. If you can get a surgeon and oncologist to agree on a treatment plan, then it's a good sign.
Posts.Signature: Age 37 dx 1/31/05 IDC 8cm nodes+, #? Grade 3 ER/PR-/Her-2- miscarriage 13 wks chemo 2/22/05 TAC, every 3 wks masectomy planned after chemo
Posts.Title: breast cancer care

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with Stage III breast cancer so chemo was an obvious choice. However, I've met so many women through support groups and friends of friends who had early stage breast cancer and then had a reoccurance and some ended up mestasticizing. Sounds like it's a big crap shoot.

Posts.Content: MB, Are you taking Taxol or Taxotere? I'm taking the later with rounds of TAC every three weeks. Ativan helps me to sleep for at least 5 or six hours straight. I think after a few days I start feeling OK.

Posts.Title: Stage III

Posts.Content: I had a bitch of a time with mine. The good news is that it did not get infected. The surgical nurse I spoke with a week after it was put in suggested that because the surgeon found a vein and then lost it for awhile, he may have had to do some extra poking around, causing extra bruising. This is what I was instructed to do. When they say use the arm as normal, they REALLY mean it. If it's too stiff or sore, get a moist electric heating pad from a medical supply store. Rest your upper arm off the arm of a couch or something so that the elbow lower arm are not resting on anything. Keep the moist heat on for 10 -20 minutes while you stretch the arm. Adding a hammer or 1 - 2 pound weight to the arm can help stretch it. Bend it every few minutes then resume the stretch. I know this is safe from physical therapy for the other arm that was broken last spring. Even if the arm hurts use it to carry groceries and other things. The more you baby the arm, the stiffer it will get. Also do NOT follow the advice of one of my NPs: taking ibuprofen for the swelling. My stomach was mess for days after that. Tylenol and the heating pad are the way to go in this case. Good luck
Posts.Signature: Age 37 dx 1/31/05 IDC 8cm nodes+, #? Grade 3 ER/PR-/Her-2- miscarriage 13 wks chemo 2/22/05 TAC, every 3 wks masectomy planned after chemo
